title: Re: :-(
content:
Sorry Harvey, I couldn't help myself [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Here's a hint though - when you're about to post something, ask yourself this:

Is this post related to Commander Keen, and if so, is it providing new information that nobody else has mentioned yet?

You'll find that posts about cheese are spam because they're not related to Commander Keen, and your posts comprising largely of emotikeens are also considered spam as they're not providing any useful information.

For example, when you're replying to Levellord's regular story updates with a post full of drooling smilies, it doesn't really add anything to the topic so it's spam - but when you post info about bugs in games that's interesting because nobody else has posted about that before.

title: Re: Do you like Harvey?
content:
I cracked up upon seeing the one and only "No" as an option. Why has no-one ever done something like this before? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

EDIT:[quote]Quote:[hr]I'm sorry I'm posting spam, but I don't know what you guys (and gals[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ) consider spam...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] [hr][/quote]
The problem we have is that you have shown that you are unable to judge what is and isn't annoying. Because of this, you need a different set of rules applied to you than other forum members.

1. Post related things (eg bugs in games) in one topic.
2. Do not post non-Keen related links. If you think you've found something Keen-related that might be new and interesting, search for it on Google before posting it to see how many sites link to it already. If lots of sites link to it, we probably know about it already. I would tell you to use the ezBoard search function, but it's not very useful. (To say the least.)
3. If you have nothing new or useful to add, don't say anything. Just posting "Cool! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] " or "That's bad. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] " isn't useful, unless you can explain (in detail) why you think it is.
4. Roleplaying is annoying, unless you have a refined sense of humour - this is why not many people post roleplays. (We tried to make LL stop, but so far all efforts have failed.) In short, you should not post roleplays.
5. Read the forum rules. Re-read them.
6. Do not tell people about your projects until you have worked on them for at least two weeks and have something to show for them (like a demo or a screenshot).

These aren't all general rules - just rules custom-suited to you. As long as you follow these rigourously, you shouldn't be yelled at too much for being annoying.

title: Wtf, dude?
content:
Najawa's getting better... but that post of Harvey's above leaves me questioning his ability to improve without resorting to a post limit [and you're not alone in your suspicions, KR].

Harvey seems like he could contribute alot to this community if he'd only settle down and think before he posts.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]
